newsData.title: Trump Warns of Economic Disaster if Court Strikes Down Tariffs
newsData.summary: The president has crowed about the billions of dollars collected so far from tariffs. That money could be at risk if the White House loses the legal battle.

newsData.title: Trump, Seeking Friendlier Economic Data, Names New Statistics Chief
newsData.summary: President Trump fired the Bureau of Labor Statistics chief earlier this month after a downbeat jobs report. The move has raised concerns about the credibility of economic data going forward.

newsData.title: Trump Extends China Tariff Truce by Three Months
newsData.summary: President Trump’s order continues a reprieve from the threat of escalating tariffs and export controls, which rocked the global economy earlier this year.

newsData.title: Small Businesses Brace for the Punishing Side Effects of Trump’s Tariffs
newsData.summary: Large firms with big bank balances, workers already in jobs and households near the top of the income ladder will have an easier time navigating the economic waves.

newsData.title: Car Companies Are Paying Tariffs So You Don’t Have To
newsData.summary: But automakers can’t absorb the cost forever and will soon begin to raise new car prices, analysts say.

newsData.title: New Tariff on ‘Transshipped’ Goods Mystifies Importers
newsData.summary: The Trump administration levied a hefty tariff on goods that are moved through other countries, but it has not yet fully explained its plans.

newsData.title: ‘A Loyalist Inside the Building’: Trump’s Temporary Fed Pick Could Have a Lasting Effect
newsData.summary: Stephen I. Miran may spend only a few months on the central bank’s board of governors, but in that time he can influence the discussions around interest rates and who will become the institution’s next leader.

newsData.title: Swiss Businesses Fear Being ‘Annihilated’ by One of the World’s Highest Tariffs
newsData.summary: Goods shipped from the country face a 39 percent tariff in the U.S., which companies warn will have dire consequences if President Trump cannot be quickly dissuaded.

newsData.title: Here’s What Could Get More Expensive Under Trump’s Tariffs
newsData.summary: The tariffs are driving up prices on everyday goods as businesses warn they can no longer absorb costs, leaving consumers to foot the bill.

newsData.title: Effect of U.S. Tariffs on British Companies Is ‘Milder Than Feared,’ Central Bank Says
newsData.summary: Britain’s economy is driven by domestic factors more than global ones right now, the governor of the Bank of England said on Thursday, when the central bank cut interest rates.

newsData.title: Stocks End Mixed, as Investors Take Steeper Tariffs in Stride
newsData.summary: The S&P 500 ended the day 0.1 percent lower, a muted move compared to the upheaval when tariffs were first announced in early April.

newsData.title: Southeast Asia Looks for Clarity From U.S. on ‘Rules of Origin’
newsData.summary: Thailand, Vietnam and other countries in the region face much higher tariffs on exports with Chinese-made components. But questions remain on how the U.S. defines a locally made product.

newsData.title: Apple C.E.O. Gifts Trump Gold
newsData.summary: Tim Cook presented a glass plaque on a gold base to President Trump and pledged an additional $100 billion investment in the U.S. as Trump threatened a 100 percent tariff on foreign semiconductors.

newsData.title: China’s Exports Surged Again in July, but Not to America
newsData.summary: China is shipping more goods to Southeast Asia and other regions that often re-export them to the United States. China still sells three times as much to the United States as it buys.

newsData.title: Staggering U.S. Tariffs Begin as Trump Widens Trade War
newsData.summary: The duties, which the president announced last week, took effect for about 90 countries just after midnight.
